The Chase Chasers are known for their amazing brain power but this year the genii have hit headlines because of their phenomenal physical transformations.

The smart crowd, who compete on the ITV gameshow, have been focusing on their appearances with Mark Labbett, 54, losing a hefty amount of weight as well as his co-star Paul Sinha, 49, and Chaser and I'm A Celebrity star Anne Hegerty, 61.

Bright red-head Jenny Ryan, 37, has also surprised fans with a glamorous image overhaul since she stepped onto the stage as part of The X Factor : Celebrity.

(Image: Liverpool ECHO)

Mark Labbett, known as 'The Beast', has lost a massive three-stone - which he credits to cutting back on sugar and running around after his young son for his transformation.

The brainbox, who weighed 27 stone at his heaviest, has been focused on losing weight over the past six months and has successfully slimmed down.

Mark was pushed to work on getting a trimmer physique after he was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes which can be caused by obesity.

As well as getting rid of the sugar in his diet, Mark got results when he started eating breakfast.

Similarly to Mark, Paul Sinha, whose quiz name persona is titled The Sinnerman, was diagnoses with Type 2 diabetes in 2018.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

The diagnosis spurred him on to lose a stone and he has spoken of his hopes of shifting more pounds.

As part of his healthy lifestyle journey, the trained doctor took part in ITV's documentary Diabetes: The Fast Fix last year.

On the series he took part in experimental medical trial living on a diet of just 800 calories per day for four weeks.

The aim of the show was to see whether it was possible for Paul to 'fast himself better'.

Since then Paul, who's full name is Supriya Kumar Sinha, has been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease - which is a progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Another Chaser who has flaunted a sensation body transformation is 'The Governess' Anne Hegerty.

The clever star, who appeared on I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here 2018, benefited from huge weight loss after being in the Australian outback.

The TV personality has managed to keep off the weight after losing it due to the reality TV series' strict diet.

She was restricted to a very basic diet in the jungle which resulted in her waistline shrinking and she has continued to keep her trimmer figure nearly a year later.

Anne has also stepped up the style stakes in recent red carper appearances by dazzling in glitzy frocks and wowing with elegant make-up - which is a dramatic change from her grey two-piece suit and high-neck shirt she dons on The Chase.

(Image: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

Fans have also been surprised by general knowledge extraordinaire Jenny Ryan's stunning transformation as she competes on The X Factor: Celebrity.

The Bolton native, who returned to the talent competition following huge public demand, left viewers in shock by her glamorous appearance.

Looking a world away from her alter ego ‘The Vixen’, Jenny looked almost unrecognisable from her teatime tele persona.

She ditched her thick rimmed glasses for contact lenses and switched up her hair by slicking her fringe and curly locks back into a sleek and straight style.

Jenny oozed confidence as she dressed in diva style covered in glittering sequins and dazzling fringing - a contrast to her usual dark dresses and tights.
